dmca.title: [EV1-C1712986V] Use of Nintendo Mark
dmca.body:
-----Original Message----- From: abuse@theplanet.com [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] Posted At: Wednesday, November 08, 2006 2:34 AM Posted To: Copyright Conversation: [EV1-C1712986V] Use of Nintendo Mark Subject: [EV1-C1712986V] Use of Nintendo Mark ==== Forwarded Ticket ==== 1. Use of Nintendo Mark Added by system at Tuesday, Nov 7 2006 12:25 pm X-MailFrom: stopinfringement@cyveillance.com X-RcptTo: abacus@abacus.ev1servers.net Received: from [70.87.6.111] by [216.12.192.78] (abacus) for ; Tue Nov 7 12:24:57 2006 Received: from mail.theplanet.com ([216.185.111.52]) by smtp02.theplanet.com with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); Tue, 7 Nov 2006 12:24:48 -0600 Return-path: Delivery-date: Tue, 07 Nov 2006 12:24:48 -0600 Received: from mx01.inside.filter.theplanet.com ([172.16.214.180] helo=mx01.filter.theplanet.com) by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from stopinfringement@cyveillance.com) with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) (Exim) id 1GhVcu-0006Gh-Cb for abuse@theplanet.com; Tue, 07 Nov 2006 12:24:48 -0600 Received: from [38.100.41.83] (helo=cyveillance.com) by mx01.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from stopinfringement@cyveillance.com) with esmtp (Exim) id 1GhVco-000Clc-AI for abuse@theplanet.com; Tue, 07 Nov 2006 12:24:42 -0600 Received: from plcicap1.prod.cyveillance.com (plcicap1.prod.cyveillance.com [10.20.1.21]) by plmail3.prod.cyveillance.com (Postfix) with ESMTP id E3478B7532; Tue, 7 Nov 2006 13:23:36 -0500 (EST) Message-ID: <13405629.1311162923876597.JavaMail.cicusr@plcicap1.prod.cyveillance.com > Date: Tue, 7 Nov 2006 13:24:36 -0500 (EST) From: stopinfringement@cyveillance.com To: abuse@theplanet.com Subject: Use of Nintendo Mark MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: text/html; charset=ANSI_X3.4-1968 Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable X-OriginalArrivalTime: 07 Nov 2006 18:24:48.0179 (UTC) FILETIME=[01CD2830:01C7029A] MIME element (text/html) 11/7/2006
 
 
N/A

 
 
Re: http://www.bitpirata.com/
 
IDENTIFIED PROBLEM: Web site uses a Nintendo trademark (Nintendo) in
the code of the page.
 

Dear N/A,
 

We are an Internet monitoring agency representing Nintendo of America
Inc. ("Nintendo"). We are writing to ask you to stop using the Nintendo
properties in the hidden text/visible text/meta tags and/or title and/or
links of the above-referenced sexually explicit Web site. Nintendo's
customers include many children and their parents. Unauthorized use of
Nintendo trademark(s)/work(s)! is harmful to those customers and will
tarnish Nintendo's reputation.
 

We look forward to your immediate confirmation that you have taken the
necessary steps to resolve this matter. To that end, you may email us at
StopInfringement@cyveilla nce.com.
 

Please note that these are automatic email boxes so typically no
response is sent as long as the problem is corrected.

 
Sincerely,
Cyveillance  ;
